channel.title: I'd like to introduce myself.
channel.description:
Hello there, everyone! I've been observing the progress of BMS for quite a while and I felt it was time to finally create an account here. I'm not sure if this is the correct sub-forum to introduce myself in, but there were no better choices.
So here I am!
I'm Jake Maheu. I'm 15 and I've been mapping in the Source engine for about a year. I originally worked with HL2 :smiley: M, but I'm now getting my feet wet in Team Fortress 2 mapping. I run my own [url='https://www.jakemaheu.com']website/blog[/url] (which I need to update, badly), and I'm fluent in HTML and CSS (not CS:S, mind you). My current project is a TF2 CP map called cp_foolsgravel. I've been working with computers since I was quite young and can fix damn near any problem you might encounter.
My thoughts on BMS:
I like the idea. From the media released so far, it seems that the team has put a ridiculous amount of effort into the project and I believe that it will turn out for the better. I'm actually getting quite antsy due to it being due within ~60 days. The transition from GoldSrc to the EP2 engine will be a dramatic change, and many will take issue with the new rendition of an older game. While most die-hard fans will consider it an improvement, there will always be detractors. Don't let them keep you down, though, because the work you're doing is amazing. The render released of the hyrdoelectric dam, quite frankly, shows what many would consider to be Valve-quality. One quick question, if you will; Is there any way for you to include the game's files in a GCF?
I'm actually quite worried for the website. Upon release, the server will be linked everywhere-- Digg, Engadget, BoingBoin, maybe even Slashdot. You'll be hit with hundreds of gigabytes of traffic. Are the servers prepared for the load? Do you have enough moderators in the forums to handle the sudden influx of new users? How is the game being distributed, by the way? Theoretically, a group of developers seeding the mod through BitTorrent could allow for a massive amount of downloads with a much smaller hit on the server. There would still be a lot of data-- the .torrent files still use a small amount of bandwidth, but the actual files would only need to be seeded until more people have downloaded it. I'd imagine that the devs have already prepared for this, though. Nonetheless, I'm happy for all of you. I've gotten a lot of laughs from this forum and I'm looking forward to the fruit of your labour.
[COLOR='Red']LOVE YOU RAMINATOR[/SIZE]
[COLOR='Green']EVERYONE WANTS TO BE A MANCHILD[/SIZE]

item.title: I'd like to introduce myself.
item.dc:creator: garrthbarrttinn
item.description:
Enjoy.
Snowcastle

It can be run on Half-Life 2 Deathmatch or Gmod.

item.title: I'd like to introduce myself.
item.dc:creator: jakemaheu
item.description:
garthbartin:

Lol, thnx. I had a lot of trouble with vis so I didn’t even run it. The map (snowcastle) doesn’t run well if you don’t have a very good computer.

Yeah, trees might help, but I’ve moved on from that map, I never finish maps very wall, I always com up with a new idea before I finish the last. But it does look WAYYYYYY better at night and with snow everywhere.

I’ll post a dl link for snowcastle if anyone wants to take screenies for me. Preferable around 5 to 10 different ones.

Gladly.

Read full topic

item.title: I'd like to introduce myself.
item.dc:creator: garrthbarrttinn
item.description:
jakemaheu:

Wow, man. That’s… far above and beyond any of my work. Did you do any optimization?

EDIT: Also, just a suggestion: Have you considered adding some of the dead trees to the landscape? It just seems kind of barren.

Lol, thnx. I had a lot of trouble with vis so I didn’t even run it. The map (snowcastle) doesn’t run well if you don’t have a very good computer.

Yeah, trees might help, but I’ve moved on from that map, I never finish maps very wall, I always com up with a new idea before I finish the last. But it does look WAYYYYYY better at night and with snow everywhere.

I’ll post a dl link for snowcastle if anyone wants to take screenies for me. Preferable around 5 to 10 different ones.

Read full topic

item.title: I'd like to introduce myself.
item.dc:creator: jakemaheu
item.description:
garthbartin:

The mapping seems the same if not easier than other games. So far my map is dev textures and only the most basic architecture; I’m waiting til I get to the safehouse to add detail. I haven’t been able to play my map in L4D yet due to unknown problems, but that could just be something stupid I haven’t figured out yet. The biggest difference is navmeshes. I’ve looked at a few tutorials though and it seems it will just take a little practice to get them down.navmeshes

Here is some old HL2Dm work I did.

pictures

I finished the snowcastle map but I am unable to release it because ALL of my screenshot programs aren’t working. Since this pic I made it night and put snow on everything and made snow falling from the sky.

Wow, man. That’s… far above and beyond any of my work. Did you do any optimization?

EDIT: Also, just a suggestion: Have you considered adding some of the dead trees to the landscape? It just seems kind of barren.

Read full topic

item.title: I'd like to introduce myself.
item.dc:creator: garrthbarrttinn
item.description:
jakemaheu:

Hey, thanks for reading! Yeah, I suppose it’s difficult to texture in HL2 M if you don’t have a set color scheme. TF2 is nicer in that regard because there are only two color schemes-- RED and BLU. I’ve been kind of interested in L4D mapping-- how difficult is it in comparison to any other game?

The mapping seems the same if not easier than other games. So far my map is dev textures and only the most basic architecture; I’m waiting til I get to the safehouse to add detail. I haven’t been able to play my map in L4D yet due to unknown problems, but that could just be something stupid I haven’t figured out yet. The biggest difference is navmeshes. I’ve looked at a few tutorials though and it seems it will just take a little practice to get them down.navmeshes

Here is some old HL2Dm work I did.
dm_dungeon

1024×768 88.9 KB

1024×768 85.2 KB

I finished the snowcastle map but I am unable to release it because ALL of my screenshot programs aren’t working. Since this pic I made it night and put snow on everything and made snow falling from the sky.

Read full topic

item.title: I'd like to introduce myself.
item.dc:creator: jakemaheu
item.description:
garthbartin:

Glanced at all your map pictures and you seem to be doing quite well. I find texture selection to be the hardest thing with HL2DM mapping (I like Greek a lot but the textures seem out of place), I’d map for TF2 but I’ve never quite liked the game. Right now I"m doing L4D mapping, the mapping part is going along quite well but getting the game to actually work is becoming a massive hassle.

Now time to read all 1100 words.

EDIT: yay, you mentioned me on your blog! I’m famous!

Hey, thanks for reading! Yeah, I suppose it’s difficult to texture in HL2 M if you don’t have a set color scheme. TF2 is nicer in that regard because there are only two color schemes-- RED and BLU. I’ve been kind of interested in L4D mapping-- how difficult is it in comparison to any other game?

Read full topic

item.title: I'd like to introduce myself.
item.dc:creator: jakemaheu
item.description:
TheeGoatPig:

Hello, and welcome to the Ladies Club. Have you tried the Biscotti?

As a matter of fact, I have not yet tried it. I’d quite like to, though. Do you have any hot chocolate?

Hazzmat:

I wish I was as good as you in English. :meh:

I try to choose my words carefully when I make a first post. I find that if you make a good first impression, people are more likely to listen/take you seriously when you speak.

item.dc:creator: JeffMOD
item.description:
jakemaheu:

Thanks, Jeff.

Just curious, are you still on dial-up? If so, I hope you’ll be able to get on DSL or cable before the launch!

Yes, yes I am. I could get highspeed in my area, but it’s too damn expensive right now. Still looking for a cheap ISP around here. :fffuuu:
I’ll get BM eventually.

Read full topic

item.title: I'd like to introduce myself.
item.dc:creator: jakemaheu
item.description:
garthbartin:

Hello, great to meet you. You seem polite and well worded, you’ll be a wonderful addition to the community.

EDIT: looked on your site and I couldn’t find any pics of your maps, was wondering if you could show off a few of them for us here.

It’s nice to meet you, too. I’ll try and put up some pictures of my older maps, but I warn you that they’re not exactly nice. The Episode 1 engine/hammer is quite unforgiving. Since I’ve switched to TF2, my life has been a great deal easier. It’s 6:15 A.M. where I’m at now, so I’ve got school in about 30 minutes. If I can get some pics up, though, I’ll let you know.

CTID:

Welcome to the forums, mate.

It’s good to see some new people who don’t act arrogant and flame the devs for “not releesing moar mediaz!!!”

Thank you. While I wouldn’t mind more media, I realize that bothering the devs slows production and annoys everyone else.

raw_bean:

Errrm, Introductions and Thanks - Share your appreciation and say hello

That aside, welcome to the forums.

I’m sorry, I didn’t notice that. My reasoning was that since The Cafeteria is for mod development, an introduction thread would be better in off-topic.

Read full topic
